snippet: Conservatives in the House have introduced a bill to protect tax-exempt groups and individuals that are opposed to same-sex marriage.
abstract: Conservative Republicans in House of Representatives press for vote on bill that would grant protection for people and organizations objecting to same sex marriage on religious grounds, while moderates in party have drafted opposing legislation; dispute puts party leaders in difficult position between conservative bloc and sentiments of public nationwide, which are trending in liberal direction.
lead_paragraph: Conservatives in the House have introduced a bill to protect tax-exempt groups and individuals that are opposed to same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Republicans Setting Sights on Same-Sex Marriage Law
headline.print_headline: Republicans Setting Sights on Same-Sex Marriage Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
